intro: Psychotria magnistipula, commonly known as the giant psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Psychotria magnistipula is notable for its role in the ecological interactions of its habitat, including its relationship with certain pollinators and mycorrhizal fungi.
